DataElement.preferredName: Bladder Urothelial Carcinoma Divergent Differentiation Percent Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric percentage of the divergent differentiation in the bladder tumor.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Bladder Urothelial Carcinoma Histologic Divergent Differentiation
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The most common morphologic subtype of urinary bladder carcinoma (over 90% of cases).  It arises from the transitional epithelium.  It most often affects males in their sixth and seventh decades of life.  Hematuria is the most common symptom at presentation.  Pathologic stage is the strongest predictor of survival._Pertaining to the combined microscopic physical features of cells and their surrounding extracellular environment in tissues._A microscopic finding indicating that a tumor exhibits more than one line of histologic differentiation.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The most common morphologic subtype of urinary bladder carcinoma (over 90% of cases).  It arises from the transitional epithelium.  It most often affects males in their sixth and seventh decades of life.  Hematuria is the most common symptom at presentation.  Pathologic stage is the strongest predictor of survival.

Concepts.definition: A carcinoma that arises from the urothelial lining of the bladder.  It is the most common morphologic type of urinary bladder carcinoma. It usually affects males in their sixth and seventh decades of life.  Hematuria is the most common symptom at presentation. Pathologic stage is the strongest predictor of survival.

Property.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to the combined microscopic physical features of cells and their surrounding extracellular environment in tissues.:A microscopic finding indicating that a tumor exhibits more than one line of histologic differentiation.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to the combined microscopic physical features of cells and their surrounding extracellular environment in tissues.
A microscopic finding indicating that a tumor exhibits more than one line of histologic differentiation.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed that is a fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Percentage; a fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
